notes: On 30 June, in Goma, unspecified amount of Lamuka members and others demonstrated against decision of the constitutional court on invalidation of dozens of opposition candidates. Police dispersed the demonstration using tear gas and live ammunition. Demonstrators reportedly resisted their dispersal, with some sources reporting demonstrators using rocks. One demonstrator was shot and killed by police, 1 injured and 3 arrested. The police, claimed some of the demonstrators were armed with firearms (although no reports of an armed clash). This marked first violent dispersion of a rally and first death of a demonstrator under Tshisekedi presidency. [size=no report]

During the clashes, the villages of Kigazura, Marunde, Kivogera, and Turambo were burned (no coordinates available). Many locals have been displaced by the communal violence following the murder of a Banyindu chief on 04/05.

Local sources accused the FARDC of supporting the NDC-Renove during the clash, which the military and other community leaders denied. The NDC-Renove remained in Loashi, while the APCLS combatants maintained control of Shoa and Buabo.

actor1: Bosonalongo Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Bosozaya Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 April 2019. Following the ruling on a land dispute between the Bosonalongo and Bosozaya villages in the Kungu territory, a group of Bosonalongo residents armed with traditional weapons attacked Bosozaya, Kungu (no coordinates available) and clashed with local residents. Three Bosozaya were seriously injured and one Bosonalongo attacker was slightly injured. The attackers burned 43 homes, two schools, and destroyed agricultural fields.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

The assailants killed a Cameroonian doctor and burned a vehicle. According to a witness, the assailants claimed Ebola was not real and the doctors were killing people by claiming it was.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) National Intelligence Agency

actor1: Militia (Ditunga)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: End of March - April. Over 12,000 people were displaced in the Kibele region of northern Beni (no coordinates available). Most of the IDPs fled to Kamango and Nobili, which can only be accessed through Uganda due to the insecurity of the region in DRC. Over 60,000 people have reportedly been displaced in North Kivu, particularly the Beni territory during the month of April. Some of the displaced are crossing into Uganda through informal crossings, bypassing immigration and health officials. Humanitarian actors are concerned about the spread of Ebola and access to assistance for those crossing informally.

assoc_actor_2: Bafuliru Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Banyindu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Babembe Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 26 February - 08 March. The Twiganeho and Gumino militias (both are Banyamulenge) clashed with Mayi Mayi groups from the Bafuliru, Banyindu, and Babembe ethnic groups in the Minembwe region (between the borders of Mwenga and Fizi). Attacks were carried out on civilians in villages in the region, including lootings and the destruction of at least six villages. 27 fatalities were reported as a result of the inter-communal violence. The fatalities were spread across incidents including clashes and attacks on civilians.

The militia reportedly resisted and surrounded the administrator, prompting the FARDC to open fire. Fatalities reported by the hospital reached 19.

Four militia members were killed, and some sources report one military fatality (spread across the two events). Local civil society organizations indicated that the FARDC does not distinguish between civilians and militia members and has utilized the populations of Babuma and Bayelo villages to loot Lowa.

notes: 15 February. The NDC-Renove clashed with APCLS and Nyatura-Jean Marie forces in Hembe, Masisi (coordinates are approximate based on OCHA map). Five combatants were killed and six people were wounded, including three civilians.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 15 February. Angry residents attacked a hand washing station - a part of the Ebola response - in Mambasa, Ituri. The residents opposed the Ebola vaccination campaign and were angry that locals were not hired as part of the response. Soldiers and police responded by firing into the air to disperse the group. A woman was injured by a stray bullet.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 15 February. Residents of Masisi and Nyabiondo protested calling for the restoration of security in the region and the resumption of medical services by MSF - who suspended activities in the region after staff members were temporarily abducted.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 15 February. Artisanal miners protested in Rubaya and Gakombe (no coordinates available) against a reduction in their salaries.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 15 February. The FARDC killed two ADF leaders - Kibuye Kajuju (aka Kadjadju and Canada) and Richard Mugisa (aka MTM)- in Mamove, Oicha.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Reunion)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 15 February. 25 Mayi Mayi Reunion members voluntarily disarmed at the FARDC base in Mboko. Another 14 Mayi Mayi combatants surrendered to the FARDC on the 17th in Lusambo, Fizi.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Shukuru)
notes: 15 February. Raia Mutomboki-Shukuru attacked Rumondo, Kalehe and abducted four boys.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: February (month of), an unidentified armed group abducted four girls between 4 and 7 years old from Kajuchu, Kabare (no coordinates available). Three days after their abduction their bodies were found, with their genitals removed.

actor1: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: In February [coded to 15 February], near Rutare, a group of approximately 4000 CNRD elements established new base.

actor1: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
notes: 14 February. FNL rebels ambushed two buses in Kagunga, Uvira. Two people were killed and 14 were injured.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 14 February. Residents of Rwangoma and LUCHA members protested, calling for increased security and the release of those abducted during the 07/02 attacks on the town.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 14 February. Police officers in Beni shot into the air in protest of their salary payments, which was less than they had expected. Those responsible were arrested.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mbulu)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 14 February. The FARDC attacked the Mayi Mayi Mbulu near Ngendo, Uvira (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The military killed three militia members and freed a hostage (who was abducted by the group on 11/02).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 14 February, in Oicha, an unidentified armed group clashed with FARDC. 1 soldier has been injured and 1 civilian killed.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 13 February. ADF combatants killed three civilians traveling to Mamove, on the Oicha-Mamove road.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 13 February. At least 200 nurses and health care workers from the Uvira territory gathered in Bukavu to demand over-due benefits.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
notes: 13 February (on or before). Disarmed Nsapu militia members occupied the Kamako primary school and imposed taxes and arbitrary arrests on the civilian population in Kamako.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
notes: Between 6 February and 11 March [coded as 5 events between the period], in Uvira area, Sukola II operation led by FARDC against local and foreign-armed groups, including RED Tabara resulted in 37 enemy combatant casualties and the capture or surrender of 52 combatants and the recovery of their weapons and ammunition.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 13 February, in Mulolya, an unidentified armed group attacked civilians, killing 2. 1 civilian was reported missing.

actor1: Bakeka Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Bakeka Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 12 February. A clash occurred in Mituku-Bamoya (no coordinates available, located in the Ubundu territory) between supporters of the new Bakeka groupment leader and supporters of the old leader. The clash resulted in several wounded from machetes.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 12 February. A soldier killed a civilian in Kibongo (no coordinates available), near Nyamilima, after the civilian refused to transport the soldier's belongings.

actor1: Civilians (South Sudan)
notes: 12 February (on or before). Over the course of a few days, approximately 5,000 refugees fleeing violence in South Sudan crossed into Congolese villages along the border, near Ingbokolo.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mesandu)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 12 February. Mayi Mayi Mesandu forces seized control of Lowa, Tshopo forcing the FARDC to withdraw from the city. Most of the civilian population also fled.

actor1: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 12 February. A Batwa militia attacked Amiko (no coordinates available; in the Bendera region). The group looted the village and abducted women, who they took into the bush to rape. The abductees were later released.

actor1: CCU: United Congolese Convention
assoc_actor_2: FCC: Common Front for Congo; CCU: United Congolese Convention
notes: 12 February. Justin Omookala, of the CCU, held a governorship campaign march in Lusambo, Sankuru. Youth from the FCC opposition threw rocks at the CCU members. Some sources indicate that the groups began street fighting and the police intervened with live ammunition, killing one and injuring others. However, other sources reported that Justin Omookala's bodyguard shot at the opposition, resulting in the death and injuries.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Eco-Guards
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 12 February. An unidentified armed group attacked national park guards in Museya, Beni. The guards, along with the FARDC, repelled the attackers, killing two.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 28 January - 02 April: The FARDC launched operations against the Mayi Mayi Simba in the Babila Babombi and Bombo communes of Mambasa territory. 38 Mayi Mayi Simba were killed during the period. 12 are coded in Mapendano on 01/03. The remaining 26 fatalities are spread between 8 events during the time period (one battle per week).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Kavumbi); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Bohoza Faction
notes: 01 January - 28 March. The NDC-R, Nyatura Kibumba, and Nyatura Bohoza raped separately at least 57 women in the Bashali-Mokoto territory, leaving three killed. Two attacks occurred on 14/01. The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: 11 February. Three FARDC soldiers were killed in Mataba, Beni by suspected UPLC combatants.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 11 February. The ADF attacked an FARDC position in Mamove, Beni. The rebels also looted the town and attempted to abduct civilians. Local civil society organizations report four rebels killed and four abductees freed. The military reported a dozen rebel fatalities (coded at lowest estimate).

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 11 February. Local residents in Mavono, Butembo set fire to the Ebola health center in the town. Reasons unclear.

actor1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
notes: 11 February. FDLR-RUD combatants abducted a man from Mirumba, Rutshuru (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The assailants demanded a ransom.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mwenyemali)
notes: 11 February. Mayi Mayi Mwenyemali abducted two people from Nyamugali, Uvira. The assailants demanded a ransom of $2,500.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mbulu)
notes: 11 February. Mayi Mayi Mbulu abducted a man from Ngendo, Uvira (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The assailants demanded a $2,000 ransom.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 11 February. An unidentified armed group attacked the FARDC in Ndombi, Oicha.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 11 February, in Mayimoya, unidentified armed group clashed with FARDC, killing 1 soldier.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 10 February. Unidentified armed men abducted a man near Bunyangula, Rutshuru (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The abductee was on his way to pay a ransom for other hostages. The assailants demanded a ransom for the abductee.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 10 February. A soldier was killed by an unidentified armed group in Vusalali (no coordinates available), in the Bashu region.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
notes: 10 February. Nyatura combatants clashed with the NDC-Renove in Nyampanika and Kashanje (no coordinates available for either village, coded as one event at Mokoto prec2), in the Bashali region.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 10 February (on or around). An unidentified armed group ambushed MONUSCO and FARDC forces along the Beni-Butembo road.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 10 February. An unidentified armed group attacked two soldiers at a checkpoint in Busalali, Beni (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map) killing one of the soldiers and injuring the other.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 10 February. An unidentified armed group attacked a FARDC base in Kiteraga, Oicha. The assailants set fire to the military site and injured one soldier.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 09 February (on or around). During the weekend, FARDC forces destroyed a rebel training center in the Wango forest, near Largu. The attack was part of an operation against the group operating in the Djugu territory. Six rebels were killed during the three hours of clashes.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 09 February. A group of suspected LRA combatants attacked civilians near Bulumasi, Bas-Uele. The assailants killed a Central African man and abducted 12 civilians, including two children.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 09 February. LRA attacked civilians near Bulumasi, Bas Uele. They killed a man from CAR and abducted 12 civilians, including three women and two children. The abductees, with the exception of one of the boys were released on 11/02.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 9 Feb 2019, an FARDC soldier killed a woman with a machete in Lyakobo neighborhood of Beni town. The FARDC soldier attempted to rape the victim who resisted.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01-28 February. 58 women and one child experienced conflict-related sexual violence in the DRC during the month of February. Coded as one attack per week.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); MSF: Doctors Without Borders
notes: 08 February. An unidentified armed group abducted two MSF employees from Bitoy (no coordinates available near Masisi town). The assailants released the abductees later that evening.

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 08 February. Approximately 140 Kamwina Nsapu combatants voluntarily disarmed in Kamako. Female youth were among the group participating in disarmament.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Prison Guards
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 February. Prisoners escaped from the Tshikapa prison. The prisoners injured a guard and stole his gun as they escaped through a hole in a wall. Nine prisoners were killed as guards attempted to capture them, two police and two former militia members were also killed. Eight other escapees were injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
notes: 08 February. FDLR FOCA forces attacked the FARDC in Tabi (no coordinates available, in the Burungu region) Masisi territory, killing three soldiers.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 February. The FARDC clashed with an armed group in Nyolo (no coordinates available), in the Djugu territory. The armed group has been utilizing the town as a base for launching attacks in the territory.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
assoc_actor_2: Batwa Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 February. Suspected ADF combatants killed three pygmies in Mavivi, Oicha.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 08 February. MONUSCO launched an offensive against the ADF in the Mayangose Forest (no coordinates available) in Beni.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 08 February. The FDLR-FOCA attacked a FARDC site at Itabi (no coordinate available, located in Masisi). The attackers beheaded two soldiers.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 February. A woman was shot and killed by unidentified perpetrators in Urii, Mahagi (no coordinates available, 19 km from Mahagi town). The assailants also removed the woman's genitals. Her body was discovered the following day. Local residents believe the genitals were removed for ritualistic purposes.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On 8 February, in Kudukudu, ADF attacked civilians, killing 4, including a child and injuring 2.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 February. An unidentified armed group attacked Mundiba. The group killed one elderly man and injured his wife. The perpetrators also set four houses on fire.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kokodikoko)
notes: 08 February 2019. Raia Mutomboki- Kokodikoko attacked Kabikokole, Mwenga (coordinates are approximate). The assailants reportedly raped 100 women. They also looted the town and burned a health center.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 8 February, at PK 9 road near Mbau, an unidentified armed group clashed with FARDC, killing 2 and injuring 3 soldiers (no further details available).

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
source: UN (unspecified); Kivu Security Tracker; Radio Moto; Radio Okapi
notes: On 7 February, in Rwangoma, an unidentified armed group (likely the ADF due to the presence of children and women within the armed group) attacked civilians, killing 6, injuring 2, abducting 8, including 6 children. The FARDC reportedly repelled the attackers but residents reported hearing gunfire into the next morning. The body of one of the abductees was found near Bwerera a few days later.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 07 February. ADF combatants attacked the FARDC in the Mbua Kamango region.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 07 February. A group of Mayi Mayi set fire to a FARDC site in Buzumba (no coordinates available), Masisi.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Teachers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 07 February. Students at the University of Kisangani, who rioted over the arrest of two students the day prior, continued to destroy property. The students attacked professor's homes and property. One woman was reportedly assaulted by the rioters.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 07 February. LUCHA members demonstrated in Goma against a barrier at the port. Police intervened and arrested seven demonstrators.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 07 February (on or around). The corpse of a woman was found in Ariwara, Ituri. The victim's genitals had been removed. Some locals believe the genitals were removed for ritualistic purposes.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 07 February (on or before). An armed group (likely the ADF due to the presence of children and women within the armed group) attacked Rwangoma. The FARDC reportedly repelled the attackers (clash coded separately) but residents reported hearing gunfire into the next morning. At least four civilian fatalities were reported (other sources indicated seven). The attackers also looted civilian property and abducted four adults and four children - the body of one of the abductees was found near Bwerera a few days later.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 06 February. University of Kisangani students demonstrated calling for the release of two students arrested in a murder case. The demonstrators burned school and teacher vehicles.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
notes: Between 6 February and 11 March [coded as 5 events between the period], in Uvira area, Sukola II operation led by FARDC against local and foreign-armed groups, including RED Tabara resulted in 37 enemy combatant casualties and the capture or surrender of 52 combatants and the recovery of their weapons and ammunition. Twelve related-fatalities separately recoded, remaining 25 spread between 5 events during the time frame.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 05 February (on or before). A soldier was attacked with machetes by an unidentified group in Rwangoma.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
notes: 05 February. The FARDC was deployed to the Kigoma region of Uvira in response to the presence of Red TABARA. Upon learning of the deployment, the armed group fled the area and the FARDC has reestablished government control of the region.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 05 February. Residents of Goma demonstrated after a police officer killed a teenager the prior night. The demonstrators set fire to the police station in Keshero, where the incident had occurred.

actor1: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: 05 February. The UPLC attacked the Kasitu (no coordinates available) health center in the Vuhovi area. The attackers burned the mattresses in the center.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 05 February. FARDC forces attacked three Mayi Mayi Charles combatants in Buramba, Rutshuru. One Mayi Mayi member was killed and weapons were seized.

notes: 28 January - 02 April: The FARDC launched operations against the Mayi Mayi Simba in the Babila Babombi and Bombo communes of Mambasa territory. 38 Mayi Mayi Simba were killed during the period. 12 are coded in Mapendano on 01/03. actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 04 February. The NDC-Renove clashed with Nyatura-Nzayi in Munongo and Kakonse (no coordinates available), as the Nyatura-Nzayi are trying to take control of Lwama (coordinates are approximate based on OCHA map) from the NDC-Renove. Four Nyatura combatants, two NDC-Renove fighters and two civilians were killed during the clashed.

actor1: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Prison Guards
notes: 04 February. The UPLC attacked a prison in Mabalako, releasing two members who had been captured during clashes on 31/01.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 04 February. Residents of the Keshero neighborhood of Goma caught a robber and police intervened to prevent the mob from attacking the robber. One police officer opened fire on the crowd of locals trying to disperse the mob, killing a teenage girl and injuring two male youths.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 04 February. Firefighters protested in Kinshasa over the government's failure to pay their salaries for 38 months.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 04 February. Members of the RTNC protested in front of the African Union headquarters in Kinshasa, demanding contract renegotiations and the resignation of Ernest Kabila, the director of the public media company.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 04 February. In conjunction with their strike over salary delays, employees of SCPT barricaded the entrance to the port with shipping containers. The employees also gathered at the entrance to the port, where they are waiting for the company to pay their salaries.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 04 February. An unidentified armed group abducted a man in Kiriva, Lubero (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The assailants killed the abductee.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Rushaba)
notes: 04 February. Mayi Mayi Rushaba assaulted a man and abducted his wife in Rugenge, Uvira. The perpetrators also looted livestock. A $1,000 ransom was demanded.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 4 February, in Mapobu (aka Kisiki), an unidentified armed group clashed with FARDC, killing 6 and injuring 2 soldiers (no further details available).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 03 February (on or before). An armed group ambushed and robbed a bus traveling from Bukavu to Uvira near Rutemba, Sud Kivu. Nine civilians were injured during the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 03 February. A soldier shot and killed a civilian in Yamokolo, Basoko.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Prison Guards
assoc_actor_2: Prisoners (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 03 February. A female prisoner was whipped 100 times after refusing advances from the prison director. The prisoner was transferred to a hospital for medical treatment.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 03 February. Following the murder of a civilian by a soldier in Yamokolo, the victims family brought the body to the territorial administrative office. Upon learning of the incident, Basoko residents gathered to protest the killing. Military forces opened fire to disperse the demonstrators, but ran out of ammunition. At which point, the mob attacked a soldier and burned him alive. The group also ransacked the police station and freed nine detainees.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Charles)
notes: 03 February. Members of the Mayi Mayi Charles clashed amongst themselves near Kamuhororo, Rutshuru. Eight members were killed, including Charles Bokande, the leader of the group.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 03 February (on or before). An unidentified armed group killed a soldier in Rwangoma, Beni. The body was discovered in a bush.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 02 February. An unidentified armed group abducted seven civilians on their way to their fields near Kasha, Rutshuru (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The assailants demanded a ransom.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 02 February. During the night, the FARDC clashed with an armed group which attacked Torges (no coordinates available, located 25 km from Blukwa, in the Bahema chieftaincy of Djugu). At least, six assailants and two soldiers were killed during the clashes.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 02 February. An armed group attacked Torges (no coordinates available, 25 km from Blukwa). The assailants looted the village, abducted four civilians and killed two others.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 02 - 03 February. An armed group abducted 14 farmers in Kashwa, Rutshuru, including 12 women. FARDC forces responded to the attack and exchanged fire with the assailants as they fled (coded in separate event).

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 02 February. The FARDC attacked Mayi Mayi Mazembe in Kanyatsi, Lubero. Two soldiers and one militia member were killed during the clashes.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 02 February. The ADF attacked the FARDC in the Boikene neighborhood of Beni. The FARDC repelled the attack. One soldier was killed.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 02 February. Two journalists covering a Lamuka rally were assaulted and injured by Lamuka supporters.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 02 February. Following clashes against the Mayi Mayi Mazembe, the FARDC looted civilian property in Kanyatsi, Lubero. The soldiers also raped a girl.

actor1: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: 02 February. UPLC combatants opened fire on a home in Kitokolu, Beni (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). Two men were killed and one was injured.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01-28 February. 58 women and one child experienced conflict-related sexual violence in the DRC during the month of February. Coded as one attack per week.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 2 February, in Kasinga, an unidentified armed group attacked civilians (no further details available).

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 01 February. Throughout the night, the APCLS clashed with Guidon's NDC-Renove in Bwenderu and Butsindo (no coordinates available for the villages, located in the Bashali-Mokoto groupment). Two APCLS and three NDC-Renove fighters were killed.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 01 January. Residents of Kindu demonstrated against increased insecurity in the city, following the murder of a merchant the day prior. The demonstrators suspect police forces are behind the insecurity and attacked the Kindu police station. Police forces responded with tear gas and live ammunition. Two students were shot, according to Radio Okapi they were killed while Actualite reported they were injured. The demonstrators also attacked a radio station, where a police officer was hiding. Military forces were deployed to restore order.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 28 January- 03 February. During the week, three soldiers were killed in the Kakombe area of Uvira by unidentified assailants.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 28 January- 03 February. During the week, the FARDC carried out operations against LRA and other armed groups in the Dungu territory. Eight camps were destroyed in Dungu and Niangara during the operations.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 30 January. In conjunction with their three day strike, TRANSCO employees in Kinshasa protested for their over due salaries and called for the resignation of the general manager of the company.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 29 January. Angry residents in Mubambiro burned military barracks to protest harassment by soldiers and insecurity.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 29 January. An unidentified armed group looted Loa Numbi, Kalehe. The assailants forced a man, a woman and three boys to carry the stolen property. No indication if they were released after.

assoc_actor_1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Kavumbi); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Bohoza Faction
notes: 01 January - 28 March. The NDC-R, Nyatura Kibumba, and Nyatura Bohoza raped separately at least 57 women in the Bashali-Mokoto territory, leaving three killed. Two attacks occurred on 14/01. The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 28 January - 02 April: The FARDC launched operations against the Mayi Mayi Simba in the Babila Babombi and Bombo communes of Mambasa territory. 38 Mayi Mayi Simba were killed during the period. 12 are coded in Mapendano on 01/03. The remaining 26 fatalities are spread between 8 events during the time period (one battle per week).

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)

actor1: Militia (Mbawu Nkanka)

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

A police officer also died after being hit by a police car.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 26 January (on or before). As the Kamwina Nsapu has begun disarming, members of the militia sought to disarm the police force in Nganza. The police fired into the air to repel the militia members.

This source also noted that the civilian population defended itself against the attackers.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kakule)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 23 January. The military arrested Kamate Mungumwa and Muhindo Mbiriki, two leaders of the Mayi Mayi Mazembe in Kirumba. The leaders were unarmed at the time of arrest.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Prison Guards

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 23 January, in Kididiwe, unidentified armed group attacked civilians, injuring 1. 1 civilian was reported missing.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Chuyi)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kakule)
notes: 22 January. Kakule's militia abducted 39 fishermen (other sources indicated 20) on Lake Edward.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 21-22 January. Five civilians died during clashes in and around Luke between the FARDC and Nyatura Kasongo. Fatalities spread across two events.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 22 January. The FARDC clashed with the Simba militia in Dembele (coordinates are approximate based on reports that the village is 15-17 km from Nia Nia, along the Kisangani road). The groups leaders, Manu and Abley, were killed along with five other members of the militia.

actor1: Militia (Moise Tshiombe)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 22 January. Moise Tshiombe's militia crossed paths with the FARDC in Demba, as the armed group was traveling to Kananga to disarm. The soldiers attempted to disarm the militia on the spot, sparking a clash between the groups. One soldier was killed. Much of the local population fled, fearing retaliation by the military.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Bohoza Faction
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 22 January. The Nyatura Bohoza faction clashed with the APCLS in Nyabyara and Luala (no coordinates available), near Kahira in Masisi. Four civilians and seven fighters were killed during the clashes.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

notes: 22 January. Imbonerakure clashed with Red TABARA, FNL and Mayi Mayi Kihebe in Kifuni (no coordinates available), in the Kigoma area. The Imbonerakure pushed the armed groups into the Kitavuka Mbegere forest. Movements of Burundi military forces and Imbonerakure were reported across the border into the Kigoma area of DRC the same day.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 - 31 January. During the month of January, 44 people from the Kiwanja area were kidnapped, including 11 children. The abductions are carried out by armed groups and criminals who seek ransoms. Most of the abductions target women. Coded as one VAC event each week of January.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Buhirwa)
notes: 22 January. Mayi Mayi Buhirwa abducted a man from Narunanga, Uvira. The assailants demanded a $2,000 ransom.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 22 Jan 2019, a policeman shot and killed a woman in Butare village of Masisi territory.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 21 January, in Mapobu, the  ADF attacked and killed 25 FARDC soldiers and injured 22 other. Additionally 5 soldiers were reported missing. The UN Group of Experts collected evidence that corroborated this information. During the same period, several sources witnessed a high number of injured ADF combatants brought back to ADF camps, indicating their involvement in attacks and clashes. FARDC seized a type 80 general purpose machine gun from an ADF combatant.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: 01 January - 28 March. The NDC-R, Nyatura Kibumba, and Nyatura Bohoza raped separately at least 57 women in the Bashali-Mokoto territory, leaving three killed. Two attacks occurred on 14/01. The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 21 January. An armed group shot at an Oxfam vehicle in Rutobogo (coordinates are approximate, based on location 2 km west of Sake) and raped two women. The driver escaped. The armed group then ambushed a motorbike, killing two riders, while one managed to escape. Locals indicated that this group is also responsible for abductions in the area but provided no further details.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 21 January. The LRA barricaded the Dungu-Doruma road at Kana village. They then abducted 15 people and looted property, food, and money.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 21-22 January. Five civilians died during clashes in and around Luke between the FARDC and Nyatura Kasongo. Fatalities spread across two events.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 09-23 January (on or around). FARDC led two weeks of military operations against FDLR bases in Nord-Kivu, regaining key posts such as the FDLR base in Faringa, Bwito (Rutshuru). After Faringa was captured, fighting continued in Rubaya of Masisi as the FDLR fighters tried to retreat to Sud-Kivu. 10 fatalities during operations. Coded as two events per week, two in Faringa, two in Rubaya, with 10 fatalities spread across the events.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 21 January. Police dispersed Lamuka supporters who gathered at the MLC headquarters in Kinshasa to listen to Martin Fayulu.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 21 January. An armed group (suspected to be the same that carried out attacks in Rutobogo earlier on the same day), attacked Kimoka during the night. The perpetrators raped two women, killed another, and wounded three men.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 21 January. An unidentified group abducted two men from the Benengule neighborhood of Beni. The assailants tortured one of the abductees before releasing him. The man died of his injuries.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 21 January. Two unidentified armed men killed an elderly woman in the Rukangaga area of Kiliba, Uvira.

actor1: NDC-G: Nduma Defence of Congo (Guidon)
notes: On 21 Jan 2019, the NDC Guidon attacked a Nyatura Nzayi position in Munongo village of Masisi territory. NDC Guidon militants chased Nyatura Nzayi fighters from their position. A man drowned during their escape.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 01-31 January 2019. During the month of January, FRPI, who were in the midst of peace negotiations, looted at least three villages in the Aveba and Geti areas. The assailants raped a 15 year-old girl during one of the attacks. Coded as three events at random points in January - two looting and one violence against civilians.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

notes: 01 May 2019. The FARDC and FDLR clashed near Kakomero, Rutshuru (no coordinates available; in the Rugari area). Two soldiers were killed during the clashes.

actor1: Twa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mwenyemali)

actor1: Twa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 03 January. An armed Twa militia ambushed a candidate from Kongolo's convoy on their way to Lubumbashi on the Kalemie-Kabwela-Pweto-Lubumbashi road. Two people were killed and another was injured.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Fimbo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Kavumbi); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Bohoza Faction
notes: 01 January - 28 March. The NDC-R, Nyatura Kibumba, and Nyatura Bohoza raped separately at least 57 women in the Bashali-Mokoto territory, leaving three killed. Two attacks occurred on 14/01. The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
notes: 01 January (on or around). Nyatura forces established a base at Ngugo village (coordinates are appoximate based on OCHA map), in the Rutshuru territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 - 31 January. During the month of January, 44 people from the Kiwanja area were kidnapped, including 11 children. The abductions are carried out by armed groups and criminals who seek ransoms. Most of the abductions target women. Coded as one VAC event each week of January.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 31 December. An unknown group set fire to three voting machines which were located at a CENI employee's home in Katanda.

actor1: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 31 December. The government cut internet and SMS access across the country. They also cut the radio signal of RFI and revoked the press credentials of one of the outlets journalist after the station reported on preliminary election results. The restrictions were implemented to prevent the spread of rumors as the presidential election tallies are completed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 31 December. An unidentified armed group killed two women in Kasenga and stole their livestock.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Militia (Kamwina Nsapu)

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 30 December. A CENI employee in Boma was attacked by a mob of voters when he went to replace a malfunctioning machine. The mob suspected him of bringing a fraudulent machine. Police intervened.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019); Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua); Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe); NDC: Nduma Defence of Congo; NDC-G: Nduma Defence of Congo (Guidon); APCLS-M: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (Mapenzi); Nyatura-FDLR Coalition: Nyatura -Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda; Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Domi Faction
notes: 30 December. Voter intimidation during the voting for the presidential elections reported in various areas of Nord-Kivu. Security forces interfered with voting at some polling locations in Mulimbi and Butare (Rutshuru) and Mutongo (Walikale). Armed groups also interfered: the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua for Shadary in Walikale territory; NDC and Mayi Mayi Mazembe in Kasiki, Bunyatenge, Kinyatsi, and Mbwavinywa (Lubero); NDC-Guidon and APCLS Mapenzi for Shadary at polls in Mwendabandu ((Bukombo, Lwibo, Lushebere, Ngesha, Bugoye, Bushore, Bonde villages)) (Masisi territory). Meanwhile, Nyatura-FDLR coalition and Nyatura-Domi for Fayulu in polling sites in the Bwito region (Rutshuru).

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

The demonstrators burned tires and ransacked a Ebola facility, causing the patients to flee. The home of a police officer was also set on fire. Security forces fired to disperse the rioters. One demonstrator was killed, three police were injured, four LUCHA members were injured and 17 rioters were arrested.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 21 December (on or before). LRA forces moved into Nango, where they are preventing the local population from leaving. The group is looting food goods from the village and forcing the youth to transport the looted goods for them.

notes: On 21 Dec 2018, a FARDC soldier shot dead a civilian man in Mamundioma locality of Beni territory. The victim had demanded the soldier to repay his debt to him.

notes: 20 December. MONUSCO deployed additional peacekeepers throughout Beni and increased the number of patrols to provide additional security before the elections.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: 20 December. Students at the University of Kinshasa protested, demanding elections happen as scheduled.

actor1: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 19 December. The government in Kinshasa banned all campaign rallies and events in the city four days before the presidential election. This came as the Lamuka Coalition was set to hold a meeting in the city. Police forces also blocked Lamuka presidential candidate Martin Fayulu's convoy in Nsele to prevent him from entering Kinshasa city later on.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

The police brought the journalist to the politician's house, where they beat him for several hours. He was later taken to a police station in Kinshasa.

actor1: Batende Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Naval Forces
source: AFP; MONUSCO; Radio Okapi; UN HRC
notes: 17 December. Suspected Batende militia members attacked Nkolo 2, a Banunu community. Two naval officers attempted to repel the attackers, but one of the soldiers was killed and the other is missing. Much of the Nkolo 2 population had fled following the Yumbi city attack on 16/12. A MONUSCO investigation confirmed at least 10 fatalities in Nkolo 2. Homes, churches and schools were destroyed. Investigations found that the attacked on the Banunu were likely planned in advance.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Ndarumanga)

actor1: Batende Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Banunu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo); Men (Democratic Republic of Congo)
source: AFP; MONUSCO; Radio Okapi; UN HRC
notes: 17 December. Following the attack on Yumbi city on 16/12, suspected Batende militia members attacked Bongende, Yumbi. The assailants mutilated the victims, removing limbs and sexual organs of men, women and children. Fetuses were cut out of pregnant women. At least one woman was raped and two children were reportedly abducted. A MONUSCO investigation confirmed 348 fatalities in Bongende, however, they suspected the actual number to be higher. Investigations found that the attacked on the Banunu were likely planned in advance and soldiers participated in the attacks on Bongende.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 17 December 2018, in unspecified location [coded to Kinshasa], unidentified armed group abducted 1 civilian (no further details available).

actor1: Batende Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Banunu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
source: AFP; MONUSCO; Radio Okapi; UN HRC
notes: 16 December. A group of 3,000 armed Batende attacked Yumbi city - particularly the neighborhoods of Noyi, Bolu, Likolo, and Ntsentseke. Local police members participated along the Batende (the head of the police had disarmed Banunu officers prior to the attack). Armed Banunu members retliated in some areas with support from a member of the naval forces. Civilians were shot, stabbed, mutilated, and burned to death; over 900 properties were damaged including homes, schools and churches. A MONUSCO investigation confirmed 170 fatalities, primarily from the Banunu community (the number may be higher due to uncounted bodies dumped into the river). The attack came after a communal dispute over the burial of the Banunu's customary chief on land belonging to Batende on 14/12. Local CSOs indicate that the group's political allegiances of the Batende with the FCC and Banunu with the Lamuka Coalition exacerbated the dispute.

notes: 11 December. Lamuka coalition supporters and police clashed in Lubumbashi amidst Fayulu's arrival for a campaign rally. Police fired tear gas and water cannons at supporters who had gathered around the city, including at Fayulu's motorcade. Fayulu's supporters burned vehicles. Police said they dispersed the Lamuka supporters for burning vehicles, while Fayulu's speakers report the police initiated it to prevent the Lamuka rally. Civil society organizations report at least one death by shooting (possibly two) and 43 injuries , while the police reported 13 injuries and denied any fatalities. The UN HRC reported three fatalities and several injuries.

actor1: CNPSC: National Coalition of the People for Congo's Sovereignty
notes: On 4 Oct 2018, Mai-Mai CNPSC militants raided Ngoma mine in Fizi territory. The attackers killed two men and wounded another. They also looted money and property.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 03 October. Protesters in Oicha took to the streets to demand the release of 17 abductees including children in majority by ADF rebels on September 22 in Mabapula.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 01-07 October. FRPI members looted 16 villages in the Geti and Aveba areas.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 03-12 October. Five women were raped by unidentified perpetrators in the Aveba area. Coded as five events at unclear dates in the interval.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

notes: 02 October. A group of armed men attacked a FARDC position in Karuruma, four attackers were killed in the army's response.

actor1: Butembo Community Militia
notes: 02 October. Two Red Cross workers were seriously wounded when community members attacked them while they were carrying out safe Ebola burials in the north-eastern city of Butembo.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 02 October. Report that Congolege forces were extorting money from DRC returneees at the border post of Kamako, 150 km south of Tshikapa, in the province of Kasai (approx. Coordinates used based on a humanitarian map). They were being forcibly returned from Angola.

actor1: Militia (Miners)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 02 October 2018. An armed group of miners clashed with police near the Kawama mine, in Haut-Katanga. The clash spilled over towards Kawama town, where a police officer shot and killed a teenager.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 02 October. LUCHA activists protested in Beni over insecurity in the territory for four years. [size=no report]

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 October. A German tourist was killed by a man belonging to a gang of four assailants in the city of Boma. His wife survived.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 October. Activists of the Fight for Change movement (LUCHA) marched in Kananga to condemn the continuing violence in Beni and to call on the authorities to secure people and their property.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: NDC-G: Nduma Defence of Congo (Guidon)

actor1: Twa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: During the month of October, Twa militias raped and gang raped 17 women along the Kalemie-Kabulo-Kioko road in Tanganyika. The attacks often occurred as the group attacked villages. Coded as four incidents each week in October.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 September. Two soldiers were wounded in Tshiawu in Nganza commune during clashes between security forces and an unidentified militia.

actor1: NDC-G: Nduma Defence of Congo (Guidon)
notes: On 30 Sept 2018, the NDC Guidon shot and killed a man near Bunangiri village in Walikale territory.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 29 September. Unidentified gunmen kidnapped a 57-year-old man from Katyaza village in Uvira territory (approx. Coordinates used based on location a few km west of Luberizi). The attackers demanded a ransom of $500 for the release of the hostage.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mwenyemali)

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 28 September. Suspected ADF attacked an army position at Mutabo killing two soldiers, some sources indicated that it was civilians who were killed. The assailants also abducted eight civilians. The army denounced an increase in raids by foreign groups from neighbouring countries.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 25 September, in unspecified location [coded to Bangadi], a group of unidentified men with AK-47s reportedly looted houses late in the evening. They abducted a young woman and used her as a porter for looted goods. She remains unaccounted for and presumed still in captivity.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Yakutumba)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 24 September. The Army regained control of a number of towns in and around Kilembwe in Fizi territory occupied for more than a week by a Mai-Mai militia led by Yakutumba (a coalition of Malaika and Alleluia militias). Yakutumba withdrew without a fight in the locality of Kilembwe. Coded as two separate events, one battle-gov regains, one non-violent transfer.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: 24 September. Police dispersed protesters at Busawa village in Mwenga territory. The population was protesting the release of the territory's administrator.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

The attackers also burned houses and looted cattle and property. Among assailants children aged 9 or 10 years old had been ordered to capture civilians.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 22 September. The ADF attacked the FARDC in Kasinga. The attack was believed to be used as a distraction prior to launching an attack on Beni town later that day.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 20-21 September. FARDC regained several territory from the Mai-Mai Yakutumba along the border between Maniema and South-Kivu over two days of fighting. On the first day, fighting in Tubangoyi (Sud-Kivu) left fatalities on both sides. The next day, clashes were reported in Kabeya (Maniema), Mai Ndombe (Sud-Kivu) and Kilembwe (Sud-Kivu). Coordinates of Tubangoyi and Mai Ndombe are approximates based on humanitarian maps.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: On 16 September, near Mbiangu, 15 men armed with AK-47s suspected to be LRA, looted civilians along the Kapili-Kana road. The assailants, who spoke Arabic and broken Lingala, abducted 1 boy.

notes: 15 September. Eleven people, including one soldier, were killed in attacks on FARDC naval forces' positions in Muvaramu, Songamoya and Tara in Djugu territory (Ituri) between 15-16 September (later reports indicated 15 fatalities). Approximately 30 people were abducted during the attacks. Eleven fatalities spread across the three locations. Approx. Coordinates used for all locations at around 80km north of Bunia along the Lake Albert.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

assoc_actor_2: Kuluna Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Men (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 15 September. Between 2 and 4 am, police apprehended seven males, including teenagers, from the Kauka neighborhood of Kalamu. Five of the detainees were found dead the following day, at least one of the victim's genitals were cut off. The two others were forcibly disappeared. The attack is believed to be part of operations targeting Kulunas and political opposition against Kabila.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 15 September (on or around). In mid-September, the ADF overtook the FARDC base in Kididiwe (coordinates approximate), in the Mayangose region. Much of the local population fled the area following the ADF's occupation.

notes: 15 September (on or around). In mid-September, the ADF overtook the FARDC base at Point 46/Malolu in the Mayangose region (no coordinates available, in the Beni territory north of Beni city). Much of the local population fled the area following the ADF's occupation.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 09 September. A person was killed in a suspected ADF attack on FARDC positions in two neighbourhoods (Ngadi and Nzuma) in Beni.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 09 September. Police shoot and member of the National Intelligence Agency in Bendera during an altercation.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 09 September. Republican Guard soldier was arrested for shooting a civilian at the public port of Goma (North Kivu). The victim was shot and wounded as he opened the door from his home to answer the call of soldiers. Motives unknown.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
assoc_actor_2: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 09 September. Two agents of the Congolese Institute for the Conservation of Nature were seriously injured during an ambush held on their convoy by suspected LRA rebels in Banda, an area in Dikuma.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 09 September. An unidentified armed group clashed with the FARDC in Mavivi, Oicha. Five fatalities were reported during attacks in Mavivi, Matembo, Nzuma, and Ngadi. The fatalities have been spread among the locations (3 events).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 09 September. An unidentified armed group clashed with the FARDC in Matembo. Five fatalities were reported during attacks in Mavivi, Matembo, Nzuma, and Ngadi. The fatalities have been spread among the locations (3 events).

actor1: Bakwa Ndaye Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Unidentified Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 09 September 2018 (on or around). During the weekend, communal tensions broke out in the Katende area, as Bakwa Ndaye assaulted over 50 members of a different ethnic group. Five houses, as well as other property, was destroyed.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 September. Twenty people were seriously injured, shops and houses looted and many other material damage reported during the skirmishes in the evening at Balese neighbourhood in Mangobo commune in Kisangani. The unrest stemmed from a dispute between the Kata motorcycle youth association of the Matete district and the Bourgeois youth association of the Balese district.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kokodikoko)
notes: 08-09 September. Masudi Alimasi Kokodikoko's Raia Mutomboki forces abducted seventeen women and girls (age 15-70) in the Shabunda territory. The group then held the women in a cave for four days, where they subjected them to rape and other forms of sexual violence. Kokodikoko raped at least nine of the women.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Eco-Guards
notes: On 8 September, near Mugalie, 5 armed suspected LRA combatants ambushed park rangers near Loy River. A park ranger and a previously abducted civilian were severely injured.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Binakwa)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On or before 07 September. The Raia Mutomboki Kokodikoko shot and killed a policeman in Bulumbu village in Bamuguba Sud grouping, east Shabunda (coordinate approx. based on source map). The policeman killed was the commander of the Kigulube police station.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 7 Sept 2018, the FARDC shot and killed a man in Kakomero village of Rutshuru territory. The FARDC suspected the victim from being a Nyatura fighter.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 07 September 2018. The FRPI looted Banikonza, Bandikama and Batine, Ituri (no coordinates available, located next to Nyakunde town).

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 06 September 2018. A suspected robber was caught and lynched by a mob in Matadi.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 05 September. Clashes between the FARDC and Nyatura fighters left at least two civilians killed and five seriously injured in the town of Rugari, Rutshuru territory, North Kivu. Among the wounded, there are two soldiers. Later reports indicate four fatalities. The military indicated that the assailants were FDLR fighters, not Nyatura combatants.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: LUCHA: Fight for Change; Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 04 September. At least 23 peaceful protesters were injured, six of them severely, while another 89 were arrested in the capital Kinshasa, and in Goma, Lubumbashi, Bukavu, Mbandaka, Mbuji-Mayi and Tshikapa as police violently dispersed peaceful protests on the use of electronic voting machines in the upcoming elections slated for 23 December. Among the arrested were seven LUCHA activists, they were released the following day.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 03 September. The ADF attacked a FARDC position in Ngadi, about 12 km from the centre of Beni city near the Rwenzori forest but they were repelled. Loyalist forces repelled them after violent clashes. Civil society claims that several assets of the population were looted by the alleged ADF during this attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On or before 03 September. The FARDC attacked unidentified gunmen who wanted to occupy the Luziba mine site in Lumbishi village in Kalehe territory.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: LUCHA: Fight for Change; Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 03 September. Fifteen activists from the Citizen's Struggle for Change movement (LUCHA) were wounded and admitted to the hospital as police dispersed a march initiated by the movement in Goma. During the demonstration, three local journalists were assaulted by the police.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 03 September. Two MONUSCO peacekeepers, two soldiers and two civilians were injured during an ADF ambush in the Ngadi area. Two civilians were also abducted but later escaped.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 03 September. An unidentified armed group ambushed a MONUSCO convoy along the Mavivi-Boikene road. Two peacekeepers were injured.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
assoc_actor_2: Mbororo Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 3 September, in Mugalie, an LRA group looted a Peuhl campsite of the food, money, and other goods.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Love)
actor2: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: 02 September. The Nyatura Love attacked two CNRD positions simultaneously in Lubwe and Kitunda villages in Rutshuru territory. One CNRD soldier was killed (fatality coded in Kitunda)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Love)
actor2: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: 02 September. The Nyatura Love attacked two CNRD positions simultaneously in Lubwe and Kitunda villages in Rutshuru territory. One CNRD soldier was killed (fatality coded in Kitunda)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Simba)
notes: 02 September 2018. Mayi Mayi Simba attacked the Nia Nia mines. Three people were killed. The assailants looted goods and abducted civilians to carry the goods. The abductees were later released.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: On 2 September, near Dikumba, 20 LRA members looted houses and abducted 1 man and 2 girls. They released the man 12 km northwest of Dikuma later that day. The 2 girls remain unaccounted for and presumed in captivity.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: On 2 September, an LRA group of 5 men and 3 boys in military and civilian attire, ambushed civilians in a field 4 km northeast of Kpegu. They looted the victims and abducted 2 men and 1 girl.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: MLC: Movement for the Liberation of Congo
notes: 01 September. Militants of the Mouvement de liberation du Congo and those of the Common Front for Congo (FCC) threw stones at each other and clashed as they gathered to greet their respective delegations at the Gemena airport (South Ubangi). The MLC militants began throwing stones at the FCC ones after learning that their delegation would not land in Gemena.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 1 Sept 2018, the Nyatura FDP and FDLR-FOCA attacked an FARDC position in Machazo village of Rutshuru territory. One civilian was killed while two FARDC soldiers and three civilians were wounded. Looting of civilian property also ocurred.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 01 September 2018. Police forces intervened in a Together for Change political rally in Lubumbashi. One person was killed and at least nine others were arrested. [size=no report]

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 31 August. Five people were killed by suspected ADF rebels in Kakuka at the border with Ituri.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 31 August. 18 people kidnapped as LRA attacked Sili village in Ango territory (Bas-Uele).

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 30 Aug 2018, the ADF attacked FARDC positions in Kinyamubiri in Beni territory. The clashes lasted over twelve hours. Two men were wounded.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 30 or 31 August. Suspected ADF militants attacked Kingamuviri, Kitismba, Kakuka, and Sayo in Beni and Oicha territories. During the attacks, one soldier and five civilians were killed. The five civilian fatalities reportedly occurred in Kakuka. One person was also raped and 2 others were injured. It is unclear in which town(s) the confrontation with the soldier and rape occurred - these were spread across event locations.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 30 or 31 August. An unidentified armed group attacked Masuluwede (no coordinates available), near Ngite. One civilian was injured.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: On 29 Aug 2018, the NDC-R shot and killed a man in Mera village in North Kivu territory. The attackers suspected the victim to be an NDC Sheka informant.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 29 August. The vice president of the youth of the locality of Mera in the territory of Walikale (North Kivu) was murdered by alleged Mai-Mai fighters of the NDC-Renovated Mwissa Shirirayi, aka Guidon in Kibua.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 29 Aug 2018, the FARDC shot and killed a 24-year-old man in Tinge village in Beni territory. They accused the victim of being a Mai-Mai.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 27 August - on or about. Elements of the NDC / Renove tried to enter the agglomeration of Kasugho in the south of Lubero territory (North Kivu) but were repulsed by the army. At least 4 of their elements were killed and another captured.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 27 August. The militiamen of the Nduma defence of Congo (NDC / Renove) movement attacked the Mai-Mai Mazembe in the Pitakongo village in the south of Lubero territory (North Kivu). NDC won after a 2h battle. Some dead and wounded reported. The village had been under Mazembe control for the last three years. Unknown casualties coded as 5.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 27 August. 21 people kidnapped as LRA attacked Sili village in Ango territory (Bas-Uele).

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 27 August 2018. An angry mob attacked the health center and police station in Bela. The riot occurred after the death of a woman who had been transferred to an Ebola center in another town. Police intervened and fired shots to disperse the demonstrators. Two police officers were injured. [size=no report]

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 26 August. LRA elements killed two policemen in the town of Banda in Bas-Uele before taking 30 people hostage. Coded as two separate events.
