notes: 26 August 2018. An unidentified armed group ambushed two men - including a journalist - in the Rutshuru territory. The assailants assaulted one of the men before abducting the journalist.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 26 August 2018. Two FARDC soldiers were ambushed and beheaded by Lendu militias in Ladejo or Wassa, Djugu. Another source reported the location as Wassa.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On August 25, members of the Unified Lumumbist Party (PALU) demonstrated in Gungu city, capital of Kwilu territory, against the inadmissibility of the candidacies of Antoine Gizenga and Adolphe Muzito in upcoming elections in that territory.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 25 August. Five people were wounded after supporters of the Unified Lumumbist Party (PALU) who had come down to ransack their party headquarters in Gungu clashed with the police in Gungu. This followed the invalidation of Antoine Gizenga's and Muzito's files in the next presidential election.

actor1: Military Forces of Angola (1975-)
notes: 25 August 2018. Two Angolan soldiers raped a woman in the bush in Kamako. Police intervened and captured one assailant, while the other fled across the border.

actor1: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 24 August. RED-Tabara clashed with an unknown group in Katoki/Katanga in the Bijombo groupement. Casualities not known.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 24 August. ADF attacked Ngadi in Beni town. The combatants clashed with the FARDC. Seventeen soldiers and one civilian were killed.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 24 Aug 2018, an FARDC soldier accidentally shot a civilian woman in Sange rural commune of Rutanga district. The victim succumbed to her wounds.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 24 August. The FARDC clashed with an unidentified group, between Jericho and Makembi - near Eringeti. One soldier was killed.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

notes: On 23 Aug 2018, the ADF attacked a FARDC position , supported by MONUSCO, in Mukoko village of Beni territory. Two people were killed.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 23 Aug 2018, an FARDC soldier shot and killed a man in Tchampundu village of Shabunda territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 23 August. An unidentified armed group abducted two civilians from Kitchanga, Rutshuru.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 22 August. An unidentified armed group killed two civilians between the towns of Mukoko and Maibo in Oicha.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Domi Faction
notes: On 21 Aug 2018, the Nyatura Domi, while attempting to capture a CNRD combatant in Katsiru village in Rutshuru territory, shot and killed a teenage girl.

notes: On 21 Aug 2018, the Mai-Mai Kifuafua Delphin Mbaenda tortured a man in Malembe village of Walikale territory, accusing him of non-payment of a debt to a local commander. The victim succumbed to his injuries.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces

notes: 19 August 2018. A man was killed near the Shari River, 7 km from Irumu, by suspected FRPI combatants.

actor1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
notes: On 16 Aug 2018, FDLR-RUD fighters raided a house in Rusaka 5 village of Rutshuru territory, shooting a man dead.

notes: 10 August. An unidentified armed group attacked Mayi-Moya and Brazza in Oicha, killing seven civilians (coded across 2 events) and abducting one.

notes: On August 9, armed men attacked the villages of Kalengera and Kishadu in Nyangezi group in the Wulungu area (South Kivu). One person killed, one injured and a girl raped. Fatality coded in one event.

notes: On August 9, armed men attacked the villages of Kalengera and Kishadu in Nyangezi group in the Wulungu area (South Kivu). One person killed, one injured and a girl raped. Fatality coded in one event.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Charles)
notes: On August 9, two fishermen on their way to fishing were kidnapped by the Mai-Mai Charles, near Magiso village, Rutshuru territory.

actor1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
notes: On August 9, FDLR-RUD militants attacked a vehicle from the Norwegian NGO NRC near Ngwenda village, Rutshuru territory. The attackers abducted six of the Ngo workers and released them on the same day.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Malaika)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 9 Aug 2018, the Mai-Mai Malaika attacked a Simba company convoy escorted by the FARDC near Mayi ya Moto village of Fizi territory. Two FARDC soldiers and two civilians were killed while another civilian was wounded. The attackers kidnapped seven men and stole money and property.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 8 Aug 2018, the ADF attacked a FARDC position in Kasinga neighborhood of Beni town. The attack left a FARDC soldier and a civilian dead. The ADF came from the forest of Mayangose.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On August 8, FARDC soldiers were able to capture four armed men and two armed women attempting to rob a gold trading post in Kalingi village, Mwenga territory. The FARDC also recovered two AK47 weapons and a grenade.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: On August 8, at least 12 civilians were killed in Kiniana, Kalungu locality, close to Kitchanga, North Kivu, during clashes between the NDC / Renove de Guidon militias and the Nyatura. According to the local police, who delivers the information, some victims have already been buried.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Charles)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On August 8, the Mai-Mai Charles have reoccupied the bays of Tchanika and Ndwali (near Rwindi), on the southwest coast of Lake Edward, in the Virunga National Park to the boundaries with the territory of Rutshuru. This followed the departure of FARDC soldiers from their positions in the area held since August.

actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 08 August. An unidentified armed group killed two soldiers and one civilian at PK 23 along the Mbau-Kamango road, in Oicha.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On August 7, police fired teargas at stone-throwing supporters of opposition leader Felix Tshisekedi in Kinshasa as he drove to the electoral commission to file his candidacy for president.

notes: On August 7, some Virunga park rangers and FARDC people burned homes and food crops in farmers' fields during a peasant eviction operation in Sekwekwe village, Rutshuru territory. They also looted sacks of maize.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On 7 Aug 2018, the ADF killed 13 people from a group of hostages who had been abducted on 3 Aug 2018 in Tubameme village, Beni territory. The bodies of the victims were found near Tubameme village.

Police fired live bullets at the protesters and arrested some, some of whom were quickly released. A young boy died of his injuries while others were hospitalised.

notes: On August 6, Mai-Mai Mazembe fighters shot and injured a young man in Bukomerwa village, Lubero territory. The 30-year-old man died two days later.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

notes: 05 August. An unidentified armed group abducted three civilians from Malolu, Beni (no coordinates available).

actor1: Kibombo Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 05 August 2018 (on or around). An armed group from the Kibombo territory burned down the villages of Uwanda and Iyokalondo (no coordinates available; located in the Dikoka district). The assailants sought control over fishing grounds. The inhabitants of the villages were forced to flee into the bush.

assoc_actor_2: Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); UN: United Nations
notes: "Seven UN local implementing partners were abducted in North Kivu on August 2nd, 2018. The convoy of two vehicles was stopped by armed assailants East of Masisi center. The Congolese nationals were kidnapped but the two drivers and their vehicles were released. On August 3rd, two of the seven staff members were released after being seriously assaulted. They were treated for their wounds in Masisi. Reportedly a ransom has been requested for the remaining staff members."
